name: Kerry Landman
content:
Kerry Anne Landman FAA is an Australian applied mathematician and philanthropist. She is honorary professor of mathematics and statistics at the University of Melbourne.
 Landman has a BSc (1974) and PhD (1978) from the University of Melbourne.[1][2]
 During her career she has applied mathematical modelling to research in a number of areas, including industry, the environment, and biology and medicine.[3]
 In 2014 Landman was awarded the ANZIAM medal.[4] She was elected Fellow of the Australian Academy of Science in May 2019.[5]
 Landman has inaugurated the Kerry Landman Scholarship to support mathematics teachers in their studies towards a Master of Teaching (Secondary) at the University of Melbourne.[6][7] She is a donor to the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra's The Pizzicato Effect[8] and the National Gallery of Victoria, through the Felton Society.[9]
 
 This biography of an Australian academic is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.

raw:
Australian applied mathematician


Kerry LandmanFAABornKerry Anne LandmanAlma materUniversity of MelbourneScientific careerFieldsApplied mathematics, mathematical modellingInstitutionsUniversity of MelbourneThesisBifurcation and stability of solutions (1978)

Kerry Anne Landman FAA is an Australian applied mathematician and philanthropist. She is honorary professor of mathematics and statistics at the University of Melbourne.
Landman has a BSc (1974) and PhD (1978) from the University of Melbourne.[1][2]
During her career she has applied mathematical modelling to research in a number of areas, including industry, the environment, and biology and medicine.[3]
In 2014 Landman was awarded the ANZIAM medal.[4] She was elected Fellow of the Australian Academy of Science in May 2019.[5]
Landman has inaugurated the Kerry Landman Scholarship to support mathematics teachers in their studies towards a Master of Teaching (Secondary) at the University of Melbourne.[6][7] She is a donor to the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra's The Pizzicato Effect[8] and the National Gallery of Victoria, through the Felton Society.[9]

^ Bond, Lucy (1 September 2020). "Kerry Landman Scholarship". Scholarships. Retrieved 29 October 2020.

^ "The Kerry Landman Scholarship 2018 Survey". Survey Monkey. Retrieved 29 October 2020.

^ "The Pizzicato Effect". Melbourne Symphony Orchestra. Retrieved 29 October 2020.

^ "Current Supporters". National Gallery of Victoria. Retrieved 29 October 2020.
